name: It's Clutch and Flow Online Quiz | Word Play | 25 Questions

questions.correct: red, white, and blue & red white and blue & red, white and blue
questions.explanation:
red, white, and blue & red white and blue & red, white and blue.

	The 50 white stars on a blue field stand for the 50 states. The red and white stripes stand for the original 13 colonies. As the U.S.A. grew, the stars were patterned in various ways.

questions.correct: John, Paul, George, and Ringo & John Paul George and Ringo & John, Paul, George and Ringo
questions.explanation:
John, Paul, George, and Ringo & John Paul George and Ringo & John, Paul, George and Ringo.

	Don't know why they were always listed in that order.

sugar and spice.

	What are little girls made of? Sugar and spice and everything nice!

salt and pepper.

	It isn't pronounced 'leaper,' it's pronounced 'lepper.'

milk and honey.

	The land of milk and honey is Canaan, yes?

bread and butter.

	They've recently discovered that margarine isn't any better for you, so, hey!

Currier and Ives.

	Nathaniel Currier and James Merritt Ives had a lithography business in the 1800s and early 1900s. They were 'Publishers of Cheap and Popular Pictures.' Today their work ain't so cheap anymore.

tea and lemon.

	I prefer tea with milk or cream rather than lemon. Did you know that if you put in both, your milk or cream will curdle?

strawberries and cream.

	Yummy! Good with shortcake, too.

rise and shine.

	There's a song that goes: 'Rise and shine and sing out your glory, glory!'

soap and water.

	Or water and shower gel.

knife and fork.

	We still retain lots of 'kn' words in English. In Chaucer's time, they still pronounced the 'k.'

questions.text: Flea and timpani (not a perfect rhyme)
questions.explanation:
tea and sympathy.

	'Tea and Sympathy' was a play by Robert Anderson. It was also a 1950s film starring Deborah Kerr.

questions.correct: clean and shining & clean and shiny
questions.explanation: clean and shining & clean and shiny.

Sears and Roebuck.

	We used to order stuff out of their catalog.

questions.correct: Rodgers and Hammerstein & Rogers and Hammerstein
questions.explanation:
Rodgers and Hammerstein & Rogers and Hammerstein.

	The famous songwriting team who created Broadway musicals like Oklahoma!

church and state.

	In the U.S., these two are supposed to be separate. But it ain't always the case.

older and wiser.

	As opposed to younger and more naive?

body and soul.

	You have to eat well, exercise, and sleep well in order to keep the two together.

Sense and Sensibility.

	The movie Sense and Sensibility starred Emma Thompson and Kate Winslet. (If you're a JA fan, try my JA quizzes!)

War and Peace.

	A classic by Leo Tolstoy--well worth reading.

black and blue.

	Some bruises are yellowish, too--blech!

sticks and stones.

	...may break my bones, but words can never hurt me.

ups and downs.

	Yup, the old rollercoaster.

butterflies and moths.

	They're in the lepidoptera group.
